required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diabetes Prevention Programming for Women With a History of Gestational Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Diabetes Prevention Programming for Women With a History of Gestational Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to offer women with a history of gestational diabetes access to diabetes prevention programming; their children 10 and older can participate.

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to offer women with a history of gestational diabetes access to diabetes prevention programming; their children 10 and older can participate. There are two potential types of participants:
1. Women and their children 10+ can consent to participate in the diabetes prevention programming offered through Dr. Hannon's center (called Encourage). Researchers will collect data at three time points, baseline, 4-6 months, and 12 months.
2. Instead of participating in Encourage, women may participate in other diabetes prevention programming/weight management programming offered by other entities. Researchers will consent these women into the study to complete 3 data collection points, baseline, 4-6 months, and 12 months. Additionally, researchers will consent women to obtain data from their chosen program. For instance, if a woman chooses to do a Diabetes Prevention Program through the YMCA, researchers will ask women to self report their weekly attendance and weight.

primary_outcome.measure: Enrollment and participation rates in a diabetes prevention intervention
primary_outcome.description: Enrollment and participation rates in a diabetes prevention intervention

secondary_outcome.description: Height and weight combined to report as BMI

arm_group.description: Women with a history of gestational diabetes will be offered 4-6 months of a diabetes prevention program.

intervention.description: Women and their children 10+ can consent to participate in the diabetes prevention programming offered through the research center. We will collect data at three time points, baseline, 4-6 months, and 12 months. 2. Instead of participating in Encourage, women may participate in other diabetes prevention programming/weight management programming offered by other entities. Researchers will consent these women into the study to complete 3 data collection points, baseline, 4-6 months, and 12 months. Additionally, researchers will consent women to obtain data from their chosen program. For instance, if a woman chooses to do a Diabetes Prevention Program through the YMCA, researchers will ask women to self report their weekly attendance and weight.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- History of gestational diabetes in a previous pregnancy
- Age 18+
Exclusion Criteria:
